choice.text: I guess I'm worth your time now?
You have quite the reputation yourself.

dialog.text: Your rreputation preceedes you. My people say you have a chance at winning the election.
Sorry, but you're not worth my time, little mouse.
I value my time and so should you. I also value information, so tell me...

choice.text: You take care of your friends.

dialog.text: What do they say about me?

choice.text: You can't create change that way.

dialog.text: Creatures of prriviledge don't know what it's like to make your on the streets. Sometimes you need to get your paws dirrty.
As long as my people arre taken care of, that's all that matters. That's what a good leader is.
Hm, I'm informed there's a prrroblem I need to attend to. Let's continue this discussion another time.
That is cerrtainly good to know.

choice.text: Thanks Captain Obvious. Can we get down to business?
It's a marathon, not a sprint.

dialog.text: Looks like you're maintaining lead over your rrival. Good work!

choice.text: Thanks Captain Obvious. Can we get down to business?
It's a marathon, not a sprint.

dialog.text: Your rrival has taken the lead in the polls. You have a lot of work ahead of you.
Straight to the point. Therre is hope for you yet!
I see you're interrested in generrating employment. I am also keen on being a job creator.
Employment is a very imporrtant issue for Summer Island. I have a project that I believe will be mutually beneficial.

choice.text: That will generate lots of income!
How will that affect the environment?

dialog.text: I want to open a casino next to the resort and attract rich whales to gamble there.

choice.text: What do I get in return?

dialog.text: I see our thoughts are interrtwined! So, you will support this endeavourr?

choice.text: Well.. okay. But you owe me.

dialog.text: Alpacita shared your concerns. I told her we will do our best to minimize environnment impact.
You have rraised yourself in my own and my distrrict's esteem. I look forrward to working more with you in the future.
You disappont me, little mouse. Perrhaps your rrival will be more amenable.
I suppose you arre right.

choice.text: I don't like the sound of that.

dialog.text: I have a prroposition for you.
I don't believe you arre a true friend yet. Come back some other time.
Just hearr me out. You can take it or leave it.
I'd like to invest $5000 in yourr campaign

choice.text: Undertood. I appreciate your faith in me.

dialog.text: Nothing, forr now. But I may need your help in the futurre.
Your naivete surrprises me sometimes. Very well then, until next time.
"Bribe" is such a harsh word. I like to think of it as an exchange of favorrs.
Excellent! I look forward to your victorious campaign.
A marvelous morning to you my good mouse.
I have nothing to say to you.
Ah, what impressive wordplay!
I see you value a good education. I do as well, and I have an idea that will elevate education on Summer Island!
I notice that you could use an upgrade to your education platform, and I have just the thing.
I have actualized a single book that contains all the knowledge our children need to learn at school.
Indeed! Now if only I could convince the local school to purchase it and replace the moldifying manuals.

choice.text: Sure, I'd be delighted to do it!
And what do I get in return?
My campaign is not a marketing tool.

dialog.text: It would be greatly gratifying to me if you would promote the book during your campaign.
Splendid! My publisher... I mean, the children of this island will be indebted to you.
I wasn't informed that we were conducting a business transaction.
I'm insulted that you would imagine I am capable of thinking such a thing!
Oh my, looks like I'm late for a lecture again. I must be off!
I have nothing to say to you.

choice.text: A great poet once said "It doesn't matter if you win by an inch or a mile..."

dialog.text: My marvelous mouse, the creatures of my district have only the most altudinous of praises for you!

choice.text: A great poet once said "It doesn't matter if you win by an inch or a mile..."

dialog.text: My good mouse, miserable news! The creatures of my district place your ruthless rival in high esteem!
I'm... not familiar with that poet. You should enlighten me on his body of work later. In the meantime...

choice.text: You haven't written another book have you?

dialog.text: I have a proposal for you, one in which you may help your favored friend.
Heavens, no. The book is doing well thanks to you!
Heavens, no. The book is doing well, no thanks to you.

choice.text: What kind of skills does he have?
Anything for my favorite feathered friend!

dialog.text: My son Owlfredo is in his final year at college, and he requires some on the job training. Would you do me the fantastic favor of hiring him for your campaign?

choice.text: Sincerest apologies, but my campaign cannot take on any dead weight.

dialog.text: Well to my supreme shame, Owlfredo isn't really the brightest bird in the flock. But if you keep him away from anything important it should be fine.
Splendid! I assure you i will repay the favor tenfold!
While this deliberate decision is perfectly understandable, I must say I'm quite hurt!

choice.text: To you as well, my oratorial owl!

dialog.text: A marvelous morning to you my good mouse!
I have nothing to say to you.
Someone who appreciates alliteration, how wonderful!

choice.text: I'd like your support in the elections.

dialog.text: What largess can I bestow upon you today?
Oh, they're really not THAT big. Here, look them up in the dictionary.

choice.text: He's a criminal, plain and simple.
He's trying to mend his ways.
Sorry, I don't really know him.

dialog.text: Before we go any further, tell me, what do you think of Catorcio?
That's indubitably what I was telling Pader Doglas, but he wouldn't listen.
Hmm, I see...
Oh, dear, would you look at the time! I have a class to attend! We will have to leave this discussion for some other time

choice.text: Good morning! How are the fish today?
Wow, you don't smell like fish!

dialog.text: Ser, good morning ser!
I think they are happy ser, because I didn't cached them.
Ya cos I din't caught even one fish today.

choice.text: Did you come from the market when you spoke to him?
Because you worship the Shin Bone

dialog.text: It's okay ser. Ser can I ask you a question? Someone tell me Pader Doglas does not like me. Why is that ser?
Okay tenk you anyway ser. I'm go to go home and do karaoke now.

choice.text: Just kidding. It's because you worship the Shin Bone.

dialog.text: No ser I took a shower.

choice.text: Don't worry I'll talk to him about it.
But the Thigh Bone is larger, so you should worship the Thigh Bone.

dialog.text: But ser, the Shin Bone's connected to da Thigh Bone! What's the problem?
I don't tink dat's right ser.  Freedom of worship is garanteed da constipation. I will talk to Pader and bring him some Organic Artisan Pa-tey.!
Tenk yu ser! Here is an organic artisan pa-tey from Alpacita. Meybe it helps!
No it's ok ser. I think he doesn't like you either. I will fix it myself.

choice.text: I see you just came from the Fish Market.

dialog.text: Good morning, ser.

choice.text: Oh, I see. How was the market?
And you didn't think to wash up first before meeting me?

dialog.text: Sorry ser, I just come from da fish market.

choice.text: Can I talk to you about the elections?

dialog.text: Ser! I sold many fish today. A good day for me!
Oh you're right ser! I'm so sorry! I will go home right now and wash. Good bye!

choice.text: I'd like to try that sometime!

dialog.text: Alpacita ser! She buys our fish and makes artisanal organic pa-tey with them.
I should go home ser and wash up because I smell. Maybe we can talk some other time.
Ya I don't know what is that also, hehe.
I have some sad news to share with you today.
Still no money? I quess your campaign is not doing well, and that means I have no time for you.

choice.text: I'm very sorry to hear that.
I thought that was what the WASI is for?

dialog.text: One of our workers got injured today. He is inthe hospital and since his employer doesn't pay for health care he has to pay for it on his own.

choice.text: 9 cubs?! Doesn't WASI support family planning?

dialog.text: It's terrible. He's supporting 9 cubs. Who will feed them now?
We do our best but there are many of us and too few donations.
That's not the point.

choice.text: I can't donate, but if I win will mandate healthcare!

dialog.text: We are asking for donations to help pay for his medical bills. Any amount would be appreciated.
Thanks for your donation friend, the workers will know where this came from.
Hmph. That's not gonna help him right now though, is it? Rest assured the WASI will remember this.

choice.text: Let it be known I stand with the proletariat!

dialog.text: Good morning! On behalf of the Worker's Alliance of Summer Island, I'm happy to accept your donation of $500.
Money talks, so if you don't have $500, who will respect you?

choice.text: You're absolutely right. Here's my donation.
Why do I feel like this is a shakedown?
I can't spend campaign funds will nilly!

dialog.text: Sorry, I assume that you are a mouse that stand in solidarity with the proletariat!
Thank you for your kind donation!

choice.text: Can I count on the proletariat in this election?
But Boo Tee Kee provides you with jobs?

dialog.text: The WASI needs all the help it can get. It stands together with Pelicarpio of the Fishing Village in our fight against the capitalists like Boo Tee Kee.
WASI is appreciative of your contribution, but it will take more than that to garner our full support. Good day!
Employing us and exploiting us are two different things.

choice.text: May the Bone be with you as well.

dialog.text: May the Bone bless you.
I cannot speak with you unless you confess your sins.
Don't mock me, child. I can appreciate a joke as much as anyone but I take matters of faith seriously.
Speaking of The Bone, I actually wanted to speak with you about something.
I seek to go on a pilgrimage to bring back a chip of the sacred Thigh Bone.
Indeed it is! I'm so glad you share my excitement.

choice.text: I'm a little short on cash right now, Pader.
It would be my honor to fund this worthy endeavor.
What do I get in return?

dialog.text: Unfortunately, it will be a costly experience. I need a good soul to provide the church with $5000 for expenses.
I understand. Perhaps another generous soul will be able to donate money.
I'm gratified that you feel that way my child. I'll make sure that my entire district knows of your generosity.

choice.text: I cannot use campaign funds this way.
In that case I would be happy to fund your pilgrimage.

dialog.text: If the blessing of the Thigh Bone are not good enough for you, rest assured I will let the district know of your generosity.

choice.text: And to you as well, Pader.
Actually I've had a rough day.

dialog.text: A blessed day to you my child.
I cannot speak with you unless you confess your sins.
You have confessed your sins. Do your penance and pray to the Almighty Bone for guidance.
Then there is nothing more for us to discuss. I shall pray for your soul.

choice.text: But isn't the Shin bone connected to the Thigh Bone?

dialog.text: Blessings come to those who are faithful to the Thigh Bone. That's why it worries me that Pelicarpio allows worship of the Shin Bone in his district.

choice.text: I hate it when people say that.

dialog.text: You must always count your blessings my child.
I'm so glad you agree, my child!
An open mind is like a fortress with the gate left open.
Oh dear, it's almost time for the service and I still need to write my sermon. Let us speak again my child. Be One with the Thigh Bone.
Indeed, but the Thigh Bone is larger, and therefore more prominent.

choice.text: Bat... hala? Is that like Valhalla?

dialog.text: Bathala bless you my friend.
I'm sorry, but I'm totally getting bad vibes from you.

choice.text: Supreme Being? Pader Doglas may have some issues with that.
I feel much more enlightened now!

dialog.text: Bathala is the supreme being and creator of all this wonderful splendor!
It's so wonderful to meet someone who gives thanks to Bathala!

choice.text: I need some good vibes to help me win the election.
I'd like your support in the elections.

dialog.text: So, how can we improve each other's karma today?
The good Pader and I have very different spiritual views.
I'm so happy to help you on the path to Enlightenment!
Your honesty speaks to a good hear but our spirits need to be more intertwined before I can lend you my support.
You know, I try to be open and accepting to all, but you're really just being mean. I have to cleanse this negativity now. Goodbye.
Oh dear, it's time for my daily spiritual cleansing! Let's speak again soon. Bathala bless you!
Namaste, my friend.
Oh dear, you have a very unwelcome aura, I can't be around you.
I respect a multiplicity of beliefs and philosophies. Why stick with one when you can have them all?

choice.text: Has your organic grocery run out of kale?

dialog.text: I'm happy to see you my friend. I have heard some terrible news that truly disturbs my psyche.
No, even worse!

choice.text: Why is that bad? It provides employment.

dialog.text: Catorcio is planning to open up a casino resort!

choice.text: Don't worry, I'll talk to Catorcio about it
Perhaps this might change your mind (bribe $1000)

dialog.text: Any financial gain will totally be offset by the environmental and spiritual loss to the island. Plus it'll ruin my view of the sunset!
I'm so happy you feel the same way. Let our powers combine with Bathala and reject this encroachment on paradise!
Okay, I'm trusting you on this. Bathala be with you.
I don't trust Catorcio to do the right thing, and I am disappointed that you do. Namaste and goodbye!
Okay, I do need the money for my yoga studio.
I'm very disappointed that you would think I am capable of accepting this offer.
Oh hello, new customer! Come in, come in! I give you big discount!
Okey no ploblem, you tek a look-see ya?

choice.text: What do I need a van for?

dialog.text: Oh, I show you somesing! Just come in today! Brand new Van!
It top of line! Good stereo, speed, and fuel efficient. Save time and money!
OK no ploblem! You come back soon I got somesing else!

choice.text: I think I'll pass for now.

dialog.text: Well it depend. Van with customs. Cost $2000 with tax. But I have friend in custom. I can give you for $1000 but no receipt, OK?
Another satisfy customer! Tell your friend we got best deals!
Knock Knock...
Ako maba
This meeting never took place.
We never met
Let me tell you about my favorite 18th century visionary...
... blah * blah * ...
*play poker or something*
Grab some grub and fish with me.
That's some good fishin
Mouse, I ain't got no time for no chit chat
But a few bottles wouldn't hurt
*gulp gulp*
Bless you, my child.
* salvation and spirits *
Peace and love!
* surfing tips *
Looking for something?
* economics (the freaky kind) *
Why did the chicken cross the road?
Hahahaha *share jokes *
We don't have much to talk about.
* whispers carelessly*
